titleStmt.title: A large examination taken at Lambeth, according to his Maiesties direction, point by point, of M. G. Blakwell, made Arch-priest of England, by Pope Clement 8 Vpon occasion of a certaine answere of his, without the priuitie of the state, to a letter lately sent vnto him from Cardinall Bellarmine, blaming him for taking the oath of Allegeance. Together with the Cardinals letter, and M. Blakwels said answere vnto it. Also M. Blakwels letter to the Romish Catholickes in England, aswell ecclesiasticall, as lay.
titleStmt.author: Blackwell, George, 1546 or 7-1613.
Bellarmino, Roberto Francesco Romolo, Saint, 1542-1621.

titleStmt.title: A large examination taken at Lambeth, according to his Maiesties direction, point by point, of M. G. Blakwell, made Arch-priest of England, by Pope Clement 8 Vpon occasion of a certaine answere of his, without the priuitie of the state, to a letter lately sent vnto him from Cardinall Bellarmine, blaming him for taking the oath of Allegeance. Together with the Cardinals letter, and M. Blakwels said answere vnto it. Also M. Blakwels letter to the Romish Catholickes in England, aswell ecclesiasticall, as lay.
titleStmt.author: Blackwell, George, 1546 or 7-1613.
Bellarmino, Roberto Francesco Romolo, Saint, 1542-1621.

publicationStmt.publisher: By Robert Barker, printer to the Kings most excellent Maiestie,

notesStmt.note: A different examination from that recounted in STC 3105.
Bellarmino's letter and Blackwell's answer are both given in Latin and English.
With the royal arms on title page verso.
Quire (b) inner forme is in two settings; (b)2r line 2 has "Neque" with the N (1) swash or (2) plain.
Reproduction of the original in Cambridge University Library.
